body.p: This is a good technique to change the size of all raster images from your documentation. This will not work for vector images, such as PDF or SVG. If the images (PNG, for example) contain the image resolution in their metadata, this will be taken into account. For all other images, the default resolution is 120dpi.
body.note: Instead of using width and height, it is recommended that you use images that fit the page dimensions. Then you could fine-tune the images in the output using the image-resolution property (see below). This will help to prevent image rendering issues (for example, a multiple format output or a replaced image in the source file).
